t: Matthew 18
At*p the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
And*p Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,
And*p said, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Except*r ye*r be*r converted,*r and*r become*r as*r little*r children,*r ye*r shall*r not*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r

And*rp whoso*r shall*r receive*r one*r such*r little*r child*r in*r my*r name*r receiveth*r me.*r

But*rp whoso*r shall*r offend*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r which*r believe*r in*r me,*r it*r were*r better*r for*r him*r that*r a*r millstone*r were*r hanged*r about*r his*r neck,*r and*r that*r he*r were*r drowned*r in*r the*r depth*r of*r the*r sea.*r
Woe*rp unto*r the*r world*r because*r of*r offences!*r for*r it*r must*r needs*r be*r that*r offences*r come;*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r offence*r cometh!*r

Wherefore*rp if*r thy*r hand*r or*r thy*r foot*r offend*r thee,*r cut*r them*r off,*r and*r cast*r them*r from*r thee:*r it*r is*r better*r for*r thee*r to*r enter*r into*r life*r halt*r or*r maimed,*r rather*r than*r having*r two*r hands*r or*r two*r feet*r to*r be*r cast*r into*r everlasting*r fire.*r

Take*rp heed*r that*r ye*r despise*r not*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones;*r for*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r in*r heaven*r their*r angels*r do*r always*r behold*r the*r face*r of*r my*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
For*rp the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r come*r to*r save*r that*r which*r was*r lost.*r

How*rp think*r ye?*r if*r a*r man*r have*r an*r hundred*r sheep,*r and*r one*r of*r them*r be*r gone*r astray,*r doth*r he*r not*r leave*r the*r ninety*r and*r nine,*r and*r goeth*r into*r the*r mountains,*r and*r seeketh*r that*r which*r is*r gone*r astray?*r
And*rp if*r so*r be*r that*r he*r find*r it,*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r he*r rejoiceth*r more*r of*r that*r sheep,*r than*r of*r the*r ninety*r and*r nine*r which*r went*r not*r astray.*r
Even*rp so*r it*r is*r not*r the*r will*r of*r your*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven,*r that*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r should*r perish.*r

Moreover*rp if*r thy*r brother*r shall*r trespass*r against*r thee,*r go*r and*r tell*r him*r his*r fault*r between*r thee*r and*r him*r alone:*r if*r he*r shall*r hear*r thee,*r thou*r hast*r gained*r thy*r brother.*r

But*rp if*r he*r will*r not*r hear*r thee,*r then*r take*r with*r thee*r one*r or*r two*r more,*r that*r in*r the*r mouth*r of*r two*r or*r three*r witnesses*r every*r word*r may*r be*r established.*r

And*rp if*r he*r shall*r neglect*r to*r hear*r them,*r tell*r it*r unto*r the*r church:*r but*r if*r he*r neglect*r to*r hear*r the*r church,*r let*r him*r be*r unto*r thee*r as*r an*r heathen*r man*r and*r a*r publican.*r

Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Whatsoever*r ye*r shall*r bind*r on*r earth*r shall*r be*r bound*r in*r heaven:*r and*r whatsoever*r ye*r shall*r loose*r on*r earth*r shall*r be*r loosed*r in*r heaven.*r

Again*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r if*r two*r of*r you*r shall*r agree*r on*r earth*r as*r touching*r any*r thing*r that*r they*r shall*r ask,*r it*r shall*r be*r done*r for*r them*r of*r my*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
For*rp where*r two*r or*r three*r are*r gathered*r together*r in*r my*r name,*r there*r am*r I*r in*r the*r midst*r of*r them.*r
Then*p came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?
Jesus*p saith unto him, I*r say*r not*r unto*r thee,*r Until*r seven*r times:*r but,*r Until*r seventy*r times*r seven.*r
Therefore*rp is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r likened*r unto*r a*r certain*r king,*r which*r would*r take*r account*r of*r his*r servants.*r
And*rp when*r he*r had*r begun*r to*r reckon,*r one*r was*r brought*r unto*r him,*r which*r owed*r him*r ten*r thousand*r talents.*r

But*rp forasmuch*r as*r he*r had*r not*r to*r pay,*r his*r lord*r commanded*r him*r to*r be*r sold,*r and*r his*r wife,*r and*r children,*r and*r all*r that*r he*r had,*r and*r payment*r to*r be*r made.*r
The*rp servant*r therefore*r fell*r down,*r and*r worshipped*r him,*r saying,*r Lord,*r have*r patience*r with*r me,*r and*r I*r will*r pay*r thee*r all.*r
Then*rp the*r lord*r of*r that*r servant*r was*r moved*r with*r compassion,*r and*r loosed*r him,*r and*r forgave*r him*r the*r debt.*r

But*rp the*r same*r servant*r went*r out,*r and*r found*r one*r of*r his*r fellowservants,*r which*r owed*r him*r an*r hundred*r pence:*r and*r he*r laid*r hands*r on*r him,*r and*r took*r him*r by*r the*r throat,*r saying,*r Pay*r me*r that*r thou*r owest.*r

And*rp he*r would*r not:*r but*r went*r and*r cast*r him*r into*r prison,*r till*r he*r should*r pay*r the*r debt.*r
So*rp when*r his*r fellowservants*r saw*r what*r was*r done,*r they*r were*r very*r sorry,*r and*r came*r and*r told*r unto*r their*r lord*r all*r that*r was*r done.*r
Then*rp his*r lord,*r after*r that*r he*r had*r called*r him,*r said*r unto*r him,*r O*r thou*r wicked*r servant,*r I*r forgave*r thee*r all*r that*r debt,*r because*r thou*r desiredst*r me:*r
Shouldest*rp not*r thou*r also*r have*r had*r compassion*r on*r thy*r fellowservant,*r even*r as*r I*r had*r pity*r on*r thee?*r
And*rp his*r lord*r was*r wroth,*r and*r delivered*r him*r to*r the*r tormentors,*r till*r he*r should*r pay*r all*r that*r was*r due*r unto*r him.*r
So*rp likewise*r shall*r my*r heavenly*r Father*r do*r also*r unto*r you,*r if*r ye*r from*r your*r hearts*r forgive*r not*r every*r one*r his*r brother*r their*r trespasses.*r
